text: Luis Sánchez Duque (born 13 November 1956) is a Spanish football manager. ==Manager career== Born in Getafe, Madrid, Sánchez Duque began his managerial career with Getafe CF in 1993, after already representing the club's predecessor as a player in the 80's. He achieved a promotion to Segunda División in his first season in charge, but was sacked in May 1995. Sánchez Duque was subsequently appointed CD Leganés manager, managing to stay two seasons in the second level. In the 1997 summer he was named Albacete Balompié manager, but was relieved from his duties in October. In December 1999, after one season back at Leganés, Sánchez Duque was appointed at the helm of CD Toledo. He eventually left the club in the following year, after suffering team relegation. On 23 December 2000 Sánchez Duque was appointed Córdoba CF manager.El Córdoba ficha a Sánchez Duque (Córdoba signs Sánchez Duque); ABC, 23 December 2000 On 1 March of the following year, after only eight matches, he was sacked.Sánchez Duque, destituido como técnico del Córdoba (Sánchez Duque, sacked as Córdoba manager); El País, 1 March 2001 On 27 November 2001 Sánchez Duque joined CD Numancia.Luis Sánchez Duque, nuevo entrenador del Numancia (Luis Sánchez Duque, new manager of Numancia); Diario AS, 27 November 2001 On 17 February 2002 he was sacked, shortly after confirming his continuity in a press conference.Luis Sánchez Duque, destituido como entrenador del Numancia (Luis Sánchez Duque, sacked as manager of Numancia); Diario AS, 17 February 2002 Sánchez Duque subsequently managed Tomelloso CF and Valencia CF Mestalla, being later assistant of the latter's main squad. He stepped down from his job in April 2007, after suffering a cardiac arrhythmia.Luis Sánchez Duque, ingresado por una arritmia cardíaca (Luis Sánchez Duque, interned due to a cardiac arrhythmia); El Mundo Deportivo, 28 April 2007 ==References== ==External links== * *Getafe Histórico profile Category:1956 births Category:Living people Category:People from Getafe Category:Spanish footballers Category:Madrilenian footballers Category:Getafe Deportivo players Category:Spanish football managers Category:Getafe CF managers Category:CD Leganés managers Category:Albacete Balompié managers Category:CD Toledo managers Category:Córdoba CF managers Category:CD Numancia managers Category:Association footballers not categorized by position
title: Luis Sánchez Duque
